DOC.brief_summary: Recombinant growth hormone is a common therapy in the pediatric population. A number of associated side effects have been described. Several years ago, a case report was published concerning a child that was treated with RGH and developed acute glaucoma. To date no study has evaluated the connection.
DOC.brief_title: Is Recombinant Growth Hormone Therapy Associated With Increased Intraoccular Pressure?
DOC.criteria: Age 618 years treatment with recombinant growth hormone Underlying Chronic diseases Family history of eye diseases elevated occular pressure prior to starting treatment
